topic: Trustworthiness and Safety in Multi-Agent Systems

  entities:
    Huang et al.|Researcher
    Yu et al.|Researcher
    Zhang et al.|Researcher
    Agent-SafetyBench|Benchmark
    Psysafe|Benchmark
    SafeAgentBench|Benchmark
    Tian et al.|Researcher
    Xu et al.|Researcher
    Dong et al.|Researcher
    AgentSmith|Project
    Zeng et al.|Researcher
    TrustAgent|Tool
    Yoffe et al.|Researcher

  proposition: Huang et al. explored multi-agent topology resilience against attacks.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Huang et al.|RESEARCHED|multi-agent topology resilience

  proposition: Yu et al. studied topological safety in multi-agent networks.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yu et al.|STUDIED|topological safety
    Yu et al.|FOCUSED_ON|multi-agent networks

  proposition: Yu et al. identified critical phenomena called Agent Hallucination and Aggregation Safety.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yu et al.|IDENTIFIED|Agent Hallucination
    Yu et al.|IDENTIFIED|Aggregation Safety

  proposition: Zhang et al. proposed Psysafe, a benchmark for evaluating safety of psychological-based attacks in multi-agent systems.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Zhang et al.|PROPOSED|Psysafe
    Psysafe|EVALUATES|psychological-based attacks

  proposition: Agent-SafetyBench evaluated LLM-based agents across 349 interaction environments and 2,000 test cases.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Agent-SafetyBench|EVALUATED|LLM-based agents
    Agent-SafetyBench|SCOPE|349 interaction environments
    Agent-SafetyBench|SCOPE|2,000 test cases

  proposition: Agent-SafetyBench found that none of the 16 tested agents surpass a 60% safety score.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Agent-SafetyBench|TESTED|16 agents
    Agent-SafetyBench|FOUND|safety score below 60%

  proposition: SafeAgentBench focuses on safety-aware task planning for embodied LLM agents.
    entity-entity relationships:
    SafeAgentBench|FOCUSES_ON|safety-aware task planning
    SafeAgentBench|TARGETS|embodied LLM agents

  proposition: SafeAgentBench offers 750 tasks covering 10 hazards.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    SafeAgentBench|OFFERS|750 tasks
    SafeAgentBench|COVERS|10 hazards

  proposition: SafeAgentBench revealed that the leading baseline rejects only 5% of hazardous tasks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    SafeAgentBench|REVEALED|leading baseline rejection rate
    SafeAgentBench|REJECTION_RATE|5% of hazardous tasks

  proposition: Tian et al. probed agent safety through manual jailbreak prompts and a virtual evil plan development team.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Tian et al.|PROBED|agent safety
    Tian et al.|USED|manual jailbreak prompts
    Tian et al.|USED|virtual evil plan development team

  proposition: Xu et al. utilized an LLM-based agent for automatic red-teaming to generate context-aware jailbreak prompts.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Xu et al.|UTILIZED|LLM-based agent
    Xu et al.|PERFORMED|automatic red-teaming
    Xu et al.|GENERATED|context-aware jailbreak prompts

  proposition: Dong et al. leveraged LLM agents to jailbreak text-to-image models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Dong et al.|LEVERAGED|LLM agents
    Dong et al.|TARGETED|text-to-image models

  proposition: AgentSmith and another work discussed malicious content propagation between generative model-based agents.
    entity-entity relationships:
    AgentSmith|DISCUSSED|malicious content propagation
    AgentSmith|FOCUSED_ON|generative model-based agents

  proposition: Zeng et al. used synthetic data to enhance privacy-preservation of LLMs in RAG scenarios.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Zeng et al.|USED|synthetic data
    Zeng et al.|ENHANCED|privacy-preservation of LLMs
    Zeng et al.|FOCUSED_ON|RAG scenarios

  proposition: TrustAgent enhanced LLM agent safety across multiple domains by identifying and mitigating potential dangers during planning.
    entity-entity relationships:
    TrustAgent|ENHANCED|LLM agent safety
    TrustAgent|OPERATES_IN|multiple domains
    TrustAgent|MITIGATES|potential dangers

  proposition: Yoffe et al. proposed the DebUnc framework to mitigate hallucination in agents using uncertainty estimations.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yoffe et al.|PROPOSED|DebUnc framework
    DebUnc framework|MITIGATES|agent hallucination
    DebUnc framework|USES|uncertainty estimations

topic: Medical Applications of Generative Foundation Models

  entities:
    Medical agents|Tool
    Multi-modal medical agents|Tool
    Generative medical models|Model
    Validation pipelines|Method

  proposition: Generative foundation models in medical applications enable automation of complex diagnostic and decision-making tasks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative foundation models|ENABLES|automation of diagnostic tasks
    Generative foundation models|ENABLES|complex decision-making tasks

  proposition: Medical agents powered by LLMs and VLMs support clinicians and patients in diagnostics, treatment planning, and patient monitoring.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Medical agents|POWERED_BY|LLMs
    Medical agents|POWERED_BY|VLMs
    Medical agents|SUPPORTS|clinicians
    Medical agents|SUPPORTS|patients
    Medical agents|ASSISTS_IN|diagnostics
    Medical agents|ASSISTS_IN|treatment planning
    Medical agents|ASSISTS_IN|patient monitoring

  proposition: Multi-modal medical agents combine text and image inputs to deliver accurate and context-aware diagnostic assistance.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Multi-modal medical agents|COMBINES|text inputs
    Multi-modal medical agents|COMBINES|image inputs
    Multi-modal medical agents|PROVIDES|accurate diagnostic assistance
    Multi-modal medical agents|PROVIDES|context-aware diagnostic assistance

  proposition: Generative models in medical video generation offer opportunities for medical education, training, and diagnostics.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative medical models|OFFERS|medical education opportunities
    Generative medical models|OFFERS|medical training opportunities
    Generative medical models|OFFERS|diagnostic opportunities

  proposition: Generated medical videos can visualize procedures, disease progression, and anatomical changes.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generated medical videos|VISUALIZES|medical procedures
    Generated medical videos|VISUALIZES|disease progression
    Generated medical videos|VISUALIZES|anatomical changes

  proposition: Automated medical report generation can analyze medical images and patient data to draft detailed reports.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Automated medical report generation|ANALYZES|medical images
    Automated medical report generation|ANALYZES|patient data
    Automated medical report generation|DRAFTS|detailed reports

  proposition: Validation pipelines cross-reference generated reports with ground-truth annotations.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Validation pipelines|CROSS_REFERENCES|generated reports
    Validation pipelines|COMPARES_WITH|ground-truth annotations
